sentences.english: They're less likely to nitpick about details that aren't relevant at this stage.
sentences.chinese: 減少他們在與主題不相關的細節上的吹毛求疵。

sentences.english: Dismiss, for example, “some niggles, some feelings of fatigue, ” he said.
sentences.chinese: 他說，比如去除“一些吹毛求疵，一些疲勞感”。

sentences.english: But early adopter buyers, analysts say, tend to be picky consumers.
sentences.chinese: 但是早期的購買者傾向於是吹毛求疵的消費者。

sentences.english: You can't imagine. Her new boyfriend is a nit-picking lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 你無法想象，她的男朋友是一個吹毛求疵的律師。

sentences.english: The intensely critical spirit is often the narrow-minded and ignorant one.
sentences.chinese: 極愛吹毛求疵的人往往是心胸狹窄和無知的人。

sentences.english: His main weakness is to quibble over unimportant things.
sentences.chinese: 他的主要缺點是愛對小事吹毛求疵。

sentences.english: Faultfinding is one talent that ought to be buried.
sentences.chinese: 吹毛求疵是人們必須埋沒的一個才幹。

sentences.english: Americans can be very picky when it comes to colors.
sentences.chinese: 老美對顏色的挑剔通常到了吹毛求疵的程度。

sentences.english: We know these are nitpicky criticisms.
sentences.chinese: 我們知道這些都是吹毛求疵的批評。

sentences.english: Indeed the errors they have focused on sound little more than nitpicks.
sentences.chinese: 的確，他們關注的錯誤好像有點吹毛求疵。

sentences.english: If you spent less time nitpicking you'd get more work done.
sentences.chinese: 如果你少花些時間在吹毛求疵上，會做好更多的事情。

sentences.english: Good feedback, though a lot of it is nitpicky.
sentences.chinese: 非常好的反饋，雖然其中不少有些吹毛求疵。

sentences.english: Ridley viewed his work with a cynical detachment.
sentences.chinese: 裏德利以一種吹毛求疵的超然態度看待他的作品。

sentences.english: The history teacher who had dragooned me into taking the exam is a nit-picking person.
sentences.chinese: 硬逼我去考試的歷史老師是個吹毛求疵的人。

sentences.english: You also have to have a balance and know when someone is nit-picking.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人總是吹毛求疵，你最好權衡一下。
